note_text:
Procedure Name: EBUS bronchoscopy
Indications: Pulmonary nodule requiring diagnosis/staging. 
Medications: Propofol infusion via anesthesia assistance  
Procedure, risks, benefits, and alternatives were explained to the patient. All questions were answered and informed consent was documented as per institutional protocol. A history and physical were performed and updated in the pre-procedure assessment record. Laboratory studies and radiographs were reviewed. A time-out was performed prior to the intervention. 
Following intravenous medications as per the record and topical anesthesia to the upper airway and tracheobronchial tree, the Q190 video bronchoscope was introduced through the mouth, via laryngeal mask airway and advanced to the tracheobronchial tree. The laryngeal mask airway was in good position. The vocal cords appeared normal. The subglottic space was normal. The trachea was of normal caliber. The carina was sharp. The tracheobronchial tree was examined to at least the first subsegmental level without endobronchial lesions visualized. Anatomy was normal with exception of what appears to be a fused anterior segment of left upper lobe with lingula. The video bronchoscope was then removed and the UC180F convex probe EBUS bronchoscope was introduced through the mouth, and advanced to the tracheobronchial tree. A systematic hilar and mediastinal lymph node survey was carried out. Sampling criteria (5mm short axis diameter) was only met in station station 4R. Sampling by transbronchial needle aspiration was performed using an Olympus EBUSTBNA 22 gauge needle. Further details regarding nodal size and number of samples are included in the EBUS procedural sheet in AHLTA. All samples were sent for routine cytology. Onsite path evaluation did not identify malignancy. The bronchoscope was then removed and the P190 ultrathin video bronchoscope was inserted into the airway and based on anatomical knowledge advanced into the left upper lobe to the area of known nodule within the anterior segment and an eccentric view of the lesion was identified with the radial EBUS. Biopsies were then performed with a variety of instruments to include peripheral needle forceps and brush. After adequate samples were obtained the bronchoscope was removed. ROSE did not identify malignancy on preliminary samples.  The bronchoscope was then removed and the P190 re-inserted into the airways. DECAMP research samples were then performed with brushing within the right upper lobe, right middle lobe and transbronchial biopsies in the RUL, RML and LUL. We ten observed for evidence of active bleeding and none was identified. The bronchoscope was removed and the procedure completed. 

Complications: 	
-None 
Estimated Blood Loss:  10 cc.
Recommendations:
- Transfer to PACU
- Await biopsy results 
- Discharge home once criteria met.

diagnostic_bronchoscopy.inspection_findings: Normal airway anatomy; fused anterior segment of LUL with lingula.

linear_ebus_stations_detail.notes: Sampling criteria met (5mm short axis). ROSE did not identify malignancy.

navigation_targets.notes: Localization based on anatomical knowledge and rEBUS.

Bronchoscopy w/transbronchial lung biopsy(s), each additional lobe (RUL)
Bronchoscopy w/transbronchial lung biopsy(s), each additional lobe (RML)
Bronchoscopy w/radial EBUS for peripheral lesion

lines.selection_reason: TBLB performed in LUL for clinical nodule. (Also RUL/RML for research, coded as add-ons).

lines.selection_reason: Additional lobe TBLB (RUL) performed (Research context included in procedural coding).

lines.selection_reason: Radial EBUS used to identify eccentric view of LUL nodule.
Bundled into surgical bronchoscopy codes (31652, 31628).
Brushing performed in same lobes as TBLB (LUL, RUL, RML). TBLB (31628/+31632) is the more extensive procedure for these sites.
Navigation system use not documented; procedure relied on 'anatomical knowledge' and radial EBUS only.

financial_analysis.mppr_assumptions: Primary (31652) at 100%. Secondary (31628) reduced by 50% of difference from base code. Add-ons (+31632, +31654) at 100%.
financial_analysis.notes: Research samples (DECAMP) coded as performed procedures; billability depends on study coverage status.

per_code.summary: Supported by EBUS-TBNA of 1 station (4R). Highest value base code, designated primary.

documentation_evidence.snippet: Sampling... was only met in station station 4R. Sampling by transbronchial needle aspiration was performed

per_code.summary: Supported by TBLB of LUL nodule. Additional research biopsies in RUL/RML support +31632.

documentation_evidence.snippet: Biopsies were then performed... to include peripheral needle forceps
transbronchial biopsies in the RUL, RML and LUL

per_code.summary: Supported by radial EBUS usage for peripheral lesion localization.

documentation_evidence.snippet: eccentric view of the lesion was identified with the radial EBUS

global_comments: Sedation (9915x) not billed as anesthesia assistance (Propofol) was used.
Diagnostic bronchoscopy (31622) bundled into therapeutic codes.
Brushing (31623) bundled/dropped in favor of TBLB (31628) in same lobes.
Research samples (DECAMP) included in procedure count as they represent performed physician work.

note_text:
Procedure Name: EBUS bronchoscopy
Indications: Pulmonary nodule requiring diagnosis/staging. 
Medications: Propofol infusion via anesthesia assistance  
Procedure, risks, benefits, and alternatives were explained to the patient. All questions were answered and informed consent was documented as per institutional protocol. A history and physical were performed and updated in the preprocedure assessment record. Laboratory studies and radiographs were reviewed. A time-out was performed prior to the intervention. 
Following intravenous medications as per the anesthesia record and topical anesthesia to the upper airway and tracheobronchial tree the Q190 video bronchoscope was introduced through the mouth. The vocal cords appeared normal. The subglottic space was normal. The trachea is of normal caliber. The carina was sharp. All left sided airways were normal without endobronchial disease to the first segmental branch. The right upper and lower lobe airways were normal without endobronchial disease to the first segmental branch. Within the right middle lobe a shiny vascular obstructive endobronchial tumor was visualized within the lateral segment of the right middle lobe. The lesion was friable and bled easily with minimal manipulation. Subsequently 6 endobronchial needle biopsies of the nodule were performed. Due to bleeding from the lesion a total of 4ml of 10mg/10ml tranexamic acid was applied topically with subsequent resolution of bleeding.  The video bronchoscope was then removed and the UC180F convex probe EBUS bronchoscope was introduced through the mouth, and advanced to the tracheobronchial tree. A systematic hilar and mediastinal lymph node survey was carried out. Sampling criteria (5mm short axis diameter) were met in station 4L, station 4R, station 7 and station 11Rs lymph nodes.  Sampling by transbronchial needle aspiration was performed in these lymph nodes using an Olympus EBUSTBNA 22 gauge needle beginning at the N3 (4L) lymph nodes 74R11Rs. Further details regarding nodal size and number of samples are included in the EBUS procedural sheet in AHLTA. All samples were sent for routine cytology. Onsite path evaluation did not identify malignancy. We then removed the EBUS bronchoscopy and inserted the therapeutic T190 Olympus bronchoscope and advanced the scope into the right middle lobe where 5 forceps endobronchial biopsies were performed. Bleeding was moderate and required intermittent mechanical tamponade with the tip of the bronchoscope. After biopsies were completed we monitored for evidence of active bleeding and none was seen. At this point the bronchoscope was removed and the procedure completed. 


Complications: 
-None 
Estimated Blood Loss:  10 cc.
Recommendations:
- Transfer to PACU
- Await biopsy results 
- Discharge home once criteria met.

diagnostic_bronchoscopy.inspection_findings: Normal vocal cords, trachea, and carina. Left airways normal. Right upper/lower normal. RML lateral segment: shiny vascular obstructive endobronchial tumor, friable.

cao_interventions_detail.notes: 4ml of 10mg/10ml TXA applied due to bleeding from RML nodule biopsy.

outcomes.follow_up_plan_text: Transfer to PACU, await results, discharge home.

cpt_codes.description: Bronchoscopy; with EBUS sampling, 3 or more nodal stations
Bronchoscopy; with transbronchial needle aspiration biopsy(s)

lines.description: Bronchoscopy with EBUS sampling, 3+ nodal stations
lines.selection_reason: EBUS-TBNA performed on 4 stations (4L, 4R, 7, 11R). Meets criteria for 31653 (3+ stations).

lines.description: Bronchoscopy with TBNA (endobronchial needle biopsy of tumor)
lines.selection_reason: Endobronchial needle biopsy of RML tumor. Distinct structure from mediastinal nodes sampled by EBUS. Modifier XS (Separate Structure) applied to unbundle from 31653.
Bundled into 31629. NCCI guidelines prevent reporting multiple biopsy techniques (needle vs forceps) on the same lesion (RML tumor) in the same session. 31629 is higher valued.
Diagnostic bronchoscopy is inherent to surgical bronchoscopy (31653/31629) performed in the same session.

financial_analysis.mppr_assumptions: Multiple Endoscopy Rule (MER) applied. 31653 paid at 100%. 31629 reduced by 50% of the difference from base endoscopy (31622). Estimated reduction applied to facility payment.

per_code.summary: Primary service. Supported by sampling of 4 distinct nodal stations (4L, 4R, 7, 11R) using EBUS guidance.

documentation_evidence.snippet: Sampling criteria... were met in station 4L, station 4R, station 7 and station 11Rs lymph nodes.

per_code.summary: Secondary service. TBNA of RML endobronchial tumor. Distinct from EBUS nodes.

documentation_evidence.snippet: Subsequently 6 endobronchial needle biopsies of the nodule were performed.

qa_flags.message: Verify payer allows modifier XS/59 for concurrent TBNA and EBUS-TBNA. Distinct anatomic targets (Tumor vs Nodes) strongly support unbundling.

per_code.summary: Dropped. Forceps biopsy of the same RML tumor sampled by needle. NCCI prevents billing two biopsy codes for the same lesion.

documentation_evidence.snippet: advanced the scope into the right middle lobe where 5 forceps endobronchial biopsies were performed.

rules_applied.details: Dropped 31622 as it is bundled with 31653/31629.
Dropped 31625 in favor of 31629 for the RML tumor (same lesion, multiple modalities). 31629 has higher RVU.
Anesthesia provided by separate assistance (Propofol infusion). Moderate sedation codes 99152/99153 not reported.

note_text:
Procedure Name: EBUS bronchoscopy, transbronchial lung biopsy and bronchoalveolar lavage
Indications: Mediastinal adenopathy and interstitial lung disease 
Medications: Propofol infusion via anesthesia assistance  
Procedure, risks, benefits, and alternatives were explained to the patient. All questions were answered and informed consent was documented as per institutional protocol. A history and physical were performed and updated in the preprocedure assessment record. Laboratory studies and radiographs were reviewed. A time-out was performed prior to the intervention. 
Following intravenous medications as per the record and topical anesthesia to the upper airway and tracheobronchial tree, the Q190 video bronchoscope was introduced through the mouth, via laryngeal mask airway and advanced to the tracheobronchial tree. The laryngeal mask airway is in good position. The vocal cords appeared normal. The subglottic space was normal. The trachea is of normal caliber. The carina is sharp. The tracheobronchial tree was examined to at least the first subsegmental level. Bronchial mucosa and anatomy were normal; there are no endobronchial lesions, and no secretions. The video bronchoscope was then removed and the UC180F convex probe EBUS bronchoscope was introduced through the mouth, via laryngeal mask airway and advanced to the tracheobronchial tree. Ultrasound was utilized to identify and measure the radiographically enlarged station 7, 4R and 11Rs lymph nodes. Sampling by transbronchial needle aspiration was performed beginning with the station 4R lymph node, followed by the station 7 lymph node and finally the 4L lymph node using an Olympus EBUSTBNA 22 gauge needle. Rapid onsite evaluation read as benign lymphoid tissue in all sampled nodes. All samples were sent for routine cytology and flow cytometry. Following completion of EBUS bronchoscopy the video bronchoscope was re-inserted and blood was suctioned from the airway. Using fluoroscopy transbronchial forceps lung biopsies were performed in both the right middle lobe and right lower lobe. Finally BAL was performed with 120cc instillation and 40cc return. Prior to removing the bronchoscope an airway examination was performed and no evidence of active bleeding was seen. The bronchoscope was removed and procedure completed. 

Complications: No immediate complications
Estimated Blood Loss: Less than 5 cc.

Post Procedure Diagnosis:
- Technically successful EBUS bronchoscopy, transbronchial lung biopsy and bronchoalveolar lavage 
- Will await final pathology and culture results

clinical_context.primary_indication: Mediastinal adenopathy and interstitial lung disease
clinical_context.radiographic_findings: Radiographically enlarged station 7, 4R and 11Rs lymph nodes

equipment.bronchoscope_model: Q190 video bronchoscope, UC180F convex probe EBUS bronchoscope

diagnostic_bronchoscopy.inspection_findings: Vocal cords normal, subglottic space normal, trachea normal caliber, carina sharp. Bronchial mucosa and anatomy normal.

outcomes.follow_up_plan_text: Will await final pathology and culture results

linear_ebus_stations_detail.notes: Identified but not sampled (implied by absence in sampling list but present in identification list, though text says 11Rs identified, usually implies 11R/11L or multiple 11R nodes)

note_spans.snippet: transbronchial forceps lung biopsies were performed in both the right middle lobe and right lower lobe

lines.selection_reason: BAL performed. Bundled with 31622 if only procedure, but separately reportable here alongside biopsy codes. NCCI allows 31624 with 31653/31628.

note_spans.snippet: BAL was performed with 120cc instillation and 40cc return

lines.selection_reason: Diagnostic bronchoscopy (31622) is bundled into surgical bronchoscopy codes (31653, 31628) performed in the same session.
Fluoroscopy is bundled into bronchoscopy codes and not separately reportable.

financial_analysis.mppr_assumptions: Multiple Procedure Payment Reduction (MPPR) applied. Primary code 31653 paid at 100%. Secondary codes (31628, 31624) reduced by ~50% (difference between total RVU and base 31622 RVU). Add-on codes (+31632) paid at 100%. Estimates are approximate.

per_code.summary: Selected as primary procedure. EBUS-TBNA performed on 3 stations (4R, 7, 4L), meeting the >=3 station requirement for 31653.

documentation_evidence.snippet: Sampling by transbronchial needle aspiration was performed beginning with the station 4R lymph node, followed by the station 7 lymph node and finally the 4L lymph node

per_code.summary: Selected for transbronchial lung biopsy in the first lobe (RML). Diagnostic bronchoscopy (31622) is bundled.

documentation_evidence.snippet: transbronchial forceps lung biopsies were performed in both the right middle lobe and right lower lobe

per_code.summary: Selected for transbronchial lung biopsy in the additional lobe (RLL). Add-on code to 31628.

documentation_evidence.snippet: transbronchial forceps lung biopsies were performed in both the right middle lobe and right lower lobe

per_code.summary: Selected for BAL. Separately reportable from biopsy codes per NCCI (no edit exists between 31624 and 31653/31628).

documentation_evidence.snippet: BAL was performed with 120cc instillation and 40cc return

per_code.summary: Dropped. Diagnostic bronchoscopy (31622) is bundled into the surgical bronchoscopy codes (31653, 31628) performed in the same session.

rules_applied.description: Diagnostic bronchoscopy (31622) bundled with surgical bronchoscopy.
Linear EBUS codes are mutually exclusive based on station count. 31653 selected for 3+ stations.

global_comments: Patient received general anesthesia (Propofol infusion via anesthesia assistance). Therefore, moderate sedation codes (99152/+99153) are NOT reported by the proceduralist.
Fluoroscopy (76000) is bundled into bronchoscopy codes and not reported separately.

Post-procedure suctioning of blood is considered part of hemostasis/toilet and does not warrant 31645 (therapeutic aspiration) as it was not the primary indication and was incidental to the procedure.

note_text:
Procedure Name: Electromagnetic navigational and radial EBUS guided bronchoscopy
Indications: right upper lobe nodule
Medications: General Anesthesia,
Procedure, risks, benefits, and alternatives were explained to the patient. All questions were answered and informed consent was documented as per institutional protocol. A history and physical were performed and updated in the pre-procedure assessment record. Laboratory studies and radiographs were reviewed. A time-out was performed prior to the intervention.
Following intravenous medications as per the record and topical anesthesia to the upper airway and tracheobronchial tree, the Q190 video bronchoscope was introduced through the mouth, via laryngeal mask airway and advanced to the tracheobronchial tree. The laryngeal mask airway was in good position. The vocal cords appeared normal. The subglottic space was normal. The trachea was of normal caliber. The carina was sharp. The tracheobronchial tree was examined to at least the first subsegmental level. Bronchial mucosa and anatomy were normal; there are no endobronchial lesions, and no secretions. Following inspection the super-dimension navigational catheter was inserted through the therapeutic bronchoscope and advanced into the airway. Using navigational map we were able to advance the 45 degree edge catheter into the anterior segment on the right upper lobe and navigated to within 1cm of the lesion. The navigational probe was then removed and peripheral radial probe was inserted into the catheter to confirm location. Ultrasound visualization yielded a concentric view affirming the location.  Needle biopsies were performed with fluoroscopic guidance. ROSE showed abundant lymphocytes and inflammatory cells but no obvious malignancy. Tissue biopsies were then performed using forceps under fluoroscopic visualization. After samples were obtained the bronchoscope was removed and the diagnostic bronchoscope was re-inserted into the airway. Subsequent inspection did not show evidence of active bleeding and the bronchoscope was removed from the airway. Fluoroscopic inspection was performed and no pneumothorax was visualized at the conclusion of the procedure. 
Complications: No immediate complications
Estimated Blood Loss: Less than 5 cc.
Post Procedure Diagnosis:
- Flexible bronchoscopy with successful electromagnetic navigation and biopsy of right upper lobe nodule. 
- Await path and flow results

diagnostic_bronchoscopy.inspection_findings: Normal vocal cords, subglottic space, trachea, and carina. Normal bronchial mucosa and anatomy; no endobronchial lesions or secretions.

navigation_targets.rose_result: Abundant lymphocytes and inflammatory cells, no obvious malignancy
navigation_targets.notes: Navigated to within 1cm of lesion; concentric REBUS view.

Bronchoscopy with transbronchial lung biopsy(s), single lobe
Bronchoscopy with transendoscopic endobronchial ultrasound (EBUS) for peripheral lesion(s)

lines.description: Bronchoscopy; with transbronchial needle aspiration biopsy(s)
lines.selection_reason: Primary sampling modality (Needle) for RUL nodule. Highest Work RVU (3.75) in family.

lines.description: Bronchoscopy; with transbronchial lung biopsy(s), single lobe
lines.selection_reason: Secondary sampling modality (Forceps) for RUL nodule. Distinct instrument use supported by text. Note: NCCI may bundle 'same lesion' sampling; modifier 59 applied to indicate distinct procedural service if payer allows.
Navigation system (SuperDimension) used to reach RUL target. Add-on to primary bronchoscopy.

lines.description: EBUS for peripheral lesion(s) during bronchoscopic intervention(s) (add-on)
lines.selection_reason: Radial EBUS probe used to visualize RUL nodule (concentric view). Add-on code.
Diagnostic bronchoscopy is bundled when therapeutic/biopsy procedures (31629, 31628) are performed.

financial_analysis.mppr_assumptions: Standard multiple endoscopy rule applied: 31629 @ 100%, 31628 @ 50% (of difference vs base), add-ons @ 100%. Note: 31628 secondary payment subject to payer bundling policies.
financial_analysis.notes: Payment estimates based on 2025 National Unadjusted rates. Facility setting assumes hospital outpatient (POS 22) where technical component is billed by facility.

per_code.summary: Selected as primary service for 'Needle biopsies'. High specificity for TBNA.

documentation_evidence.snippet: Needle biopsies were performed with fluoroscopic guidance.

per_code.summary: Selected for 'Tissue biopsies... using forceps'. Reported secondary to 31629. NCCI same-lesion bundle risk exists.

documentation_evidence.snippet: Tissue biopsies were then performed using forceps under fluoroscopic visualization.

per_code.summary: Add-on for Electromagnetic Navigation (SuperDimension). Required documentation of planning/navigation present.

documentation_evidence.snippet: super-dimension navigational catheter was inserted... navigated to within 1cm of the lesion.

per_code.summary: Add-on for Radial EBUS localization. Required documentation of view/confirmation present.

documentation_evidence.snippet: Ultrasound visualization yielded a concentric view affirming the location.

rules_applied.description: Diagnostic bronchoscopy (31622) is bundled when surgical codes (31629, 31628) are performed.
Fluoroscopy (76000) is inherent to bronchoscopy and not separately reportable.
Moderate sedation codes (99152/99153) not reported because General Anesthesia was used.

global_comments: Navigation and Radial EBUS add-ons (+31627, +31654) supported by distinct documentation steps.

Both needle (31629) and forceps (31628) biopsies were documented. While NCCI often bundles same-site sampling, they are listed here distinctively. Modifier 59 applied to 31628 to maximize compliance if billed together.
General anesthesia precludes proceduralist sedation billing.

note_text:
Procedure Name: Peripheral bronchoscopy with radial EBUS localization.
Indications: Pulmonary nodule requiring diagnosis
Medications: Propofol infusion via anesthesia assistance  
Procedure, risks, benefits, and alternatives were explained to the patient. All questions were answered and informed consent was documented as per institutional protocol. A history and physical were performed and updated in the pre-procedure assessment record. Laboratory studies and radiographs were reviewed. A time-out was performed prior to the intervention. 
Following intravenous medications as per the record and topical anesthesia to the upper airway and tracheobronchial tree, the Q190 video bronchoscope was introduced through the mouth, via laryngeal mask airway and advanced to the tracheobronchial tree. The laryngeal mask airway was in good position. The vocal cords appeared normal. The subglottic space was normal. The trachea was of normal caliber. The carina was sharp. The tracheobronchial tree was examined to at least the first subsegmental level without endobronchial lesions visualized. Anatomy was normal with exception of what appears to be a fused anterior segment of left upper lobe with lingula. The video bronchoscope was then removed and the T190 Therapeutic video bronchoscope was inserted into the airway.  A sheath catheter was advanced through the working channel into the segment of suspicion. A radial US was advanced through the sheath and concentric view of lesion was seen. Using fluoroscopy, transbronchial needle biopsies were performed. ROSE was consistent with malignancy. We then performed 6 bronchoscopic lung biopsies in the same area under fluoroscopic visualization with forceps.   
We then removed the therapeutic scope and re0inserted the Q190 videoscope. After cleaning of blood and debris no active bleeding and none was identified. Fluoroscopy was then used to scan for evidence of pneumothorax which was not seen. The bronchoscope was removed and the procedure completed. 


Complications: 	
-None 
Estimated Blood Loss:  5 cc
Recommendations:
- post-procedure CXR
- Await biopsy results 
- Discharge home once criteria met.

clinical_context.lesion_location: Segment of suspicion (Left Upper Lobe implied)

diagnostic_bronchoscopy.inspection_findings: Normal anatomy except fused anterior segment of LUL with lingula. No endobronchial lesions.

navigation_targets.target_location_text: Segment of suspicion (fused LUL/Lingula anatomy noted)

Radial EBUS used for localization of peripheral lesion.

Bundled into surgical bronchoscopy (31628).
Navigation system use not documented (only sheath/REBUS).
